author: Gus_263
title: You are right, o-in da house
review: This is one of the coolest little sets. The claws makes the Nuhvok Va's arms looks like very a small  arm of onua. The shield is symetrical and the colors are cool, of the eyes and body. It also includes a Krana on back. The tohunga feet are great, and it is awesome and different comparising with a turaga.

author: mvila09
title: 8555 Nuhvok Va
review: This little Bioncle is very cool and has nice features.Pros:The head is just brilliant,Nice green eyes,Good with Bohrok Nuhvok,The claws are very unique,The black Krana is my favorite out of all the Kranas,Left arm launches the Krana.Cons:I don't like the fact that the Krana falls out of the back every time!But you should still buy this set.*****5 stars

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Bohrok Va) - Nuhvok Va Review
review:
This is a nice figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only two pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 26 pieces and it was 3 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 12 cents per piece which is a good value for a figure like this!

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8555-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the head, the feet and the torso can be adjusted. On both hands you can see a claw which LEGO used for Toa Mata Onua. The back of the bohrok va has a piece where you can put a krana in as well. I really can't complain about this small figure - even if this set doesn't do much.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de



Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: HeroFactoryDude316
title: Nuhvok Va! Bohrok Va of Earth!
review:
This is a unique little set I got off of EBAY. With it I also got 3 other Bohrok Va.

Pros

  • 1. Simple build.
  • 2. Claws
  • 3. Awesome head.

Cons


  • 1. Low playability.
  • 2. Most parts are not new.

Overall this is a nice little set. It is worth the price I payed which was retail. If you can find the set for retail value get it, if not don't bother.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Savage Claw Mode!
review:
Set #8555 Nuvok Va: Ah yes Nuvok Va, those wonderful looking Technic three-clawed hands. I really dig those pieces, they have so much potential.

 

There's something I completely forgot about these sets when reviewing the others, all of the models are simple and straight forward to build, they also all have gimmicks. Basically you attach their Krana holding backpacks to one of their arms and when you pull it down you can launch their Krana at a Toa or Matoran enemy. These launchers get a fair bit of distance too when you put enough oomph into them.

 

As I've said before though you can easily skip most of these sets for your Bionicle collection if you want. They aren't a necessity.
